sentence: U.S. market indexes were higher on Friday.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 22,405.09 for a gain of 23.89 points or 0.11%.
The S&P 500 closed at 2,519.36 for a gain of 9.30 points or 0.37%.
The Nasdaq Composite closed at 6,495.96 for a gain of 42.51 points or 0.66%.
The VIX Volatility Index was lower for the day at 9.49 with a loss of -0.06 or -0.63%.
For the month of September, the Dow Jones gained 2.05%, the S&P 500 gained 1.89% and the Nasdaq Composite gained 1.02%.
U.S. market indexes ended higher for the month.
The S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite closed at new highs on Friday, led by technology stocks.
• The University of Michigan's Consumer Sentiment Index decreased to 95.1 from 95.3.
• The Baker Hughes rig count decreased to 1,153 from 1,155.

In the Dow Jones Industrial Average, the following stocks led gains:

In the broad market, technology stocks led gains with the S&P 500 technology sector up 0.68%.
In small-caps, the Russell 2000 Index closed at 1,490.86 for a gain of 2.08 points or 0.14%.
The S&P 600 Small-Cap Index closed at 903.98 for a gain of 2.03 points or 0.23%.
The Dow Jones Small-Cap Growth TSM Index closed at 9,043.67 for a gain of 23.29 points or 0.26%.
The Dow Jones Small-Cap Value TSM Index closed at 9,972.84 for a loss of -2.79 points or -0.03%.

Other notable index closes included the S&P 400 Mid-Cap Index at 1,795.94 for a gain of 2.31 points or 0.13%; the S&P 100 Index at 1,112.19 for a gain of 3.48 points or 0.31%; the Russell 3000 Index at 1,495.43 for a gain of 5.09 points or 0.34%; the Russell 1000 Index at 1,396.90 for a gain of 5.00 points or 0.36%; and the Dow Jones U.S.
Select Dividend Index at 671.06 for a loss of -1.06 points or -0.16%.
This article first appeared on GuruFocus .
